section.title: 初始化
section.screen:
echo "zfs_enable=YES" >> /etc/rc.conf echo 'daily_status_zfs_enable="YES"' >> /etc/periodic.conf
freebsd# vi /etc/rc.conf zfs_enable="YES"
freebsd# /etc/rc.d/zfs faststart

section.title: Creating a Basic Filesystem
section.screen:
# zpool create tank c0t0d0 # zfs create tank/fs
# mkfile 100m /tank/fs/foo # df -h /tank/fs Filesystem size used avail capacity Mounted on tank/fs 80G 100M 80G 1% /tank/fs
# zpool create tank c0t0d0 c1t0d0

section.title: Mirrored Pool
section.command: # zpool create tank mirror c0t0d0 c0t0d1
section.screen:
freebsd# zpool create tank mirror ad1 ad3 freebsd# zpool status tank pool: tank state: ONLINE scrub: none requested config:
NAME STATE READ WRITE CKSUM tank ONLINE 0 0 0 mirror ONLINE 0 0 0 ad1 ONLINE 0 0 0 ad3 ONLINE 0 0 0
errors: No known data errors

section.screen:
freebsd# zpool create zfs raidz ad1 ad3 freebsd# zpool status zfs pool: zfs state: ONLINE scrub: none requested config:
NAME STATE READ WRITE CKSUM zfs ONLINE 0 0 0 raidz1 ONLINE 0 0 0 ad1 ONLINE 0 0 0 ad3 ONLINE 0 0 0

section.title: Querying Pool Status
section.para: You can see that your pool was successfully created by using the zpool list command:
section.screen: freebsd# zpool list NAME SIZE USED AVAIL CAP HEALTH ALTROOT zfs 3.97G 234K 3.97G 0% ONLINE -

section.title: Destroying Pools
section.para: Pools are destroyed by using the zpool destroy command. This command destroys the pool even if it contains mounted datasets.
section.screen: # zpool destroy tank
section.para: Destroying a Pool With Faulted Devices
section.screen: # zpool destroy tank cannot destroy 'tank': pool is faulted use '-f' to force destruction anyway # zpool destroy -f tank

section.title: Creating a Filesystem
section.screen: freebsd# zfs create zfs/www freebsd# mount /dev/ad0s1a on / (ufs, local) devfs on /dev (devfs, local, multilabel) /dev/ad0s1e on /tmp (ufs, local, soft-updates) /dev/ad0s1f on /usr (ufs, local, soft-updates) /dev/ad0s1d on /var (ufs, local, soft-updates) zfs on /zfs (zfs, local) zfs/www on /zfs/www (zfs, local)
freebsd# zfs set compression=gzip zfs/www

section.title: Setting Quotas
section.para: we want to give bonwick a quota of 10 Gbytes
section.screen: # zfs set quota=10G tank/home/bonwick

section.title: Setting Reservations
section.screen: # zfs set reservation=5G tank/home/moore # zfs get reservation tank/home/moore NAME PROPERTY VALUE SOURCE tank/home/moore reservation 5.00G local

section.title: Querying Filesystem Information
section.screen: freebsd# zfs list NAME USED AVAIL REFER MOUNTPOINT tank 97.5K 1.95G 18K /tank tank/neo 18K 1.95G 18K /tank/neo

section.title: Renaming a Filesystem
section.screen: # zfs rename tank/home/maybee tank/ws/maybee

section.title: Destroying a Filesystem
section.screen: # zfs destroy tank/home/tabriz

# zfs destroy tank/home/ahrens cannot unmount 'tank/home/ahrens': Device busy
# zfs destroy -f tank/home/ahrens

# zfs destroy -r tank/home/schrock cannot destroy 'tank/home/schrock': filesystem has dependant clones use '-R' to destroy the following datasets: tank/clones/schrock-clone
# zfs destroy -R tank/home/schrock

section.title: zfs mount/umount
section.para: Legacy mount points must be managed through legacy tools. An attempt to use ZFS tools result in an error.
section.screen: # zfs mount pool/home/billm cannot mount 'pool/home/billm': legacy mountpoint use mount(1M) to mount this filesystem # mount -F zfs tank/home/billm

section.title: Temporary Mount Properties
section.screen: # zfs mount -o ro tank/home/perrin # zfs mount -o remount,noatime tank/home/perrin # zfs get atime tank/home/perrin NAME PROPERTY VALUE SOURCE tank/home/perrin atime off temporary

section.title: Mounting File Systems
section.screen: freebsd# zfs mount zfs/www freebsd# mount /dev/ad0s1a on / (ufs, local) devfs on /dev (devfs, local, multilabel) /dev/ad0s1e on /tmp (ufs, local, soft-updates) /dev/ad0s1f on /usr (ufs, local, soft-updates) /dev/ad0s1d on /var (ufs, local, soft-updates) zfs on /zfs (zfs, local) zfs/www on /zfs/www (zfs, local)
section.para: The -a option can be used to mount all ZFS managed filesystems. Legacy managed filesystems are not mounted.
section.screen: # zfs mount -a

section.title: Unmounting File Systems
section.screen: freebsd# zfs umount /zfs/www freebsd# mount /dev/ad0s1a on / (ufs, local) devfs on /dev (devfs, local, multilabel) /dev/ad0s1e on /tmp (ufs, local, soft-updates) /dev/ad0s1f on /usr (ufs, local, soft-updates) /dev/ad0s1d on /var (ufs, local, soft-updates) zfs on /zfs (zfs, local)

section.title: Legacy Mount Points
section.screen: freebsd# zfs set mountpoint=/tank tank freebsd# zfs mount -a freebsd# mount /dev/ad0s1a on / (ufs, local) devfs on /dev (devfs, local, multilabel) /dev/ad0s1e on /tmp (ufs, local, soft-updates) /dev/ad0s1f on /usr (ufs, local, soft-updates) /dev/ad0s1d on /var (ufs, local, soft-updates) tank on /tank (zfs, local)

section.title: Controlling Share Semantics
section.screen: freebsd# zfs set sharenfs=on zfs/www

section.title: Unsharing Filesystems
section.screen: freebsd# zfs unshare zfs/www
section.para: This command unshares the zpool filesystem. To unshare all ZFS filesystems on the system, run:
section.screen: freebsd# zfs unshare -a

section.title: Sharing Filesystems
section.screen: freebsd# zfs share zfs/www
section.para: You can also share all ZFS filesystems on the system:
section.screen: # zfs share -a

section.title: Adding Devices to a Pool
section.screen: # zpool add scoop mirror c0t1d0 c1t1d0

section.title: Taking a Device Offline
section.screen: # zpool offline tank c0t0d0 bringing device 'c0t0d0' offline

section.title: Bringing a Device Online
section.screen: # zpool online tank c0t0d0 bringing device 'c0t0d0' online

section.title: Replacing Devices
section.para: You can replace a device in a storage pool by using the zpool replace command.
section.screen: # zpool replace tank c0t0d0 c0t0d1
section.para: In the above example, the previous device, c0t0d0, is replaced by c0t0d1.

section.title: Backing Up and Restoring ZFS Data
Backing Up a ZFS Snapshot
section.screen:
# zfs backup tank/dana@111505 > /dev/rmt/0
# zfs backup pool/fs@snap | gzip > backupfile.gz

section.title: Restoring a ZFS Snapshot
section.screen: # zfs backup tank/gozer@111105 > /dev/rmt/0 . . . # zfs restore tank/gozer2@today < /dev/rmt/0 # zfs rename tank/gozer tank/gozer.old # zfs rename tank/gozer2 tank/gozer

# zfs rollback tank/dana@111505 cannot rollback to 'tank/dana@111505': more recent snapshots exist use '-r' to force deletion of the following snapshots: tank/dana@now # zfs rollback -r tank/dana@111505 # zfs restore tank/dana < /dev/rmt/0

section.title: Remote Replication of a ZFS File System
section.screen: # zfs backup tank/neo@today | ssh newsys zfs restore sandbox/restfs@today

section.title: Creating ZFS Snapshots
section.para: The following example creates a snapshot of tank/neo that is named friday.
section.screen: freebsd# zfs snapshot tank/neo@friday

section.title: Destroying ZFS Snapshots
section.para: Snapshots are destroyed by using the zfs destroy command.
section.screen: # zfs destroy tank/home/ahrens@friday

section.title: Renaming ZFS Snapshots
section.screen: # zfs rename tank/home/cindys@111205 pool/home/cindys@today

section.title: Displaying and Accessing ZFS Snapshots
section.screen: freebsd# zfs list -t snapshot NAME USED AVAIL REFER MOUNTPOINT tank/neo@friday 0 - 18K -

section.title: Rolling Back to a Snapshot
section.screen: # zfs rollback pool/home/ahrens@tuesday cannot rollback to 'pool/home/ahrens@tuesday': more recent snapshots exist use '-r' to force deletion of the following snapshots: pool/home/ahrens@wednesday pool/home/ahrens@thursday # zfs rollback -r pool/home/ahrens@tuesday

section.title: Creating a Clone
section.screen:
# zfs clone pool/ws/gate@yesterday pool/home/ahrens/bug123
# zfs snapshot projects/newproject@today # zfs clone projects/newproject@today projects/teamA/tempuser # zfs set sharenfs=on projects/teamA/tempuser # zfs set quota=5G projects/teamA/tempuser

section.title: Destroying a Clone
section.para: ZFS clones are destroyed with the zfs destroy command.
section.screen: # zfs destroy pool/home/ahrens/bug123
section.para: Clones must be destroyed before the parent snapshot can be destroyed.

section.screen: # zfs create -V 5gb tank/vol
